summary: FBI interview of a victim (referred to as [REDACTED]) who describes being recruited by friends to visit Jeffrey Epstein's home at age 16-17 to give him a massage for money. She details the massage encounter, the payment, and her feelings of shame. She identifies friends involved and provides information about Epstein's preferences and his assistant.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier whose home the victim visited. She describes massaging him while he was undressed with a towel, and receiving payment afterward. She states he was 'loaded' and liked to massage young girls.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: The primary interviewee. She describes being recruited by friends around age 16-17 to go to Epstein's New York home to give a massage for money. She details the single visit, the encounter, and her subsequent feelings of shame.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A friend of the victim from middle school. She and [REDACTED] recruited the victim to go to Epstein's home. The victim was later 'pissed off' at her after the massage.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: Another friend from middle school who recruited the victim. The victim believed Epstein only communicated with her. She had gone to Epstein's home 'a few times'.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A friend who was present at [REDACTED]'s house after the victim returned from Epstein's. The victim had the sense she knew where she had just come from.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A friend present at [REDACTED]'s house after the victim returned from Epstein's. The victim did not recall her last name.

persons.name: AUSA [REDACTED]
persons.context: Present for the FBI interview of the victim.

persons.name: Special Agent [REDACTED]
persons.context: Present for the FBI interview of the victim.

connections.description: The victim was recruited to Epstein's home where she massaged him while he was undressed and was paid in cash.
Friends from middle school who recruited the victim to go to Epstein's home.
Friends from middle school. The victim believed Epstein only communicated with [REDACTED] for recruitment.
[REDACTED] had gone to Epstein's home 'a few times' and was a primary point of contact for recruiting other girls.

events.title: Victim's visit to Epstein's home
events.description: The victim, then approximately 16-17 years old, was recruited by friends to go to Jeffrey Epstein's New York home. She gave Epstein a massage while he was undressed with a towel, following her friend's lead. Afterward, a secretary gave her and her friend white envelopes containing $250-$300.

events.title: FBI Interview of Victim
events.description: The victim was interviewed by the FBI and an AUSA in New York. She provided details of her encounter with Epstein, her recruitment by friends, and identified other individuals involved.

events.title: Victim contacts FBI hotline
events.description: After seeing Epstein's face on the news, the victim contacted the FBI hotline, leading to this interview. She had not spoken to law enforcement or lawyers before.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's home on 71st Street, New York
keyFacts: A victim describes being recruited by friends at age 16-17 to visit Jeffrey Epstein's New York home to give him a massage for money.
During the massage, Epstein was undressed with only a towel covering him. The victim and her friend were given white envelopes containing $250-$300 cash afterward by a secretary.
The victim states Epstein's preference was for young, Caucasian girls, and that being a 'Catholic school girl was a turn on for EPSTEIN.'
The victim identifies a network of friends ([REDACTED], [REDACTED]) who recruited her and had themselves visited Epstein multiple times.
The interview was triggered after the victim saw Epstein on the news and contacted the FBI hotline; she had never discussed the incident with law enforcement before.
